Sentencas: The effect of volatile boron species on the microstructure and electrocatalytic activity of conventional (La,Sr)MnO3 (LSM) and nano-structured LSM infiltrated Y2O3-ZrO2 (LSM-YSZ) cathodes of solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) is studied.
Titulo: Effect of Volatile Boron Species on the Electrocatalytic Activity of Cathodes of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells I. (La,Sr)MnO3 Based Electrodes

Sentencas: The cathodes were heat-treated at 700-800 degrees C in air for 7-30 days in the presence of borosilicate glass powder.
Titulo: Effect of Volatile Boron Species on the Electrocatalytic Activity of Cathodes of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells I. (La,Sr)MnO3 Based Electrodes

Sentencas: Compared to freshly-prepared cathodes, heat-treatment in the presence of glass improves the electrocatalytic activity of LSM cathodes, but has a significant detrimental effect on the microstructure and electrochemical activity of nano-structured LSM-YSZ cathodes.
Titulo: Effect of Volatile Boron Species on the Electrocatalytic Activity of Cathodes of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells I. (La,Sr)MnO3 Based Electrodes

Sentencas: Present study shows that boron is not chemically compatible with LSM and poisoning effect of boron is related to the size of LSM particles.
Titulo: Effect of Volatile Boron Species on the Electrocatalytic Activity of Cathodes of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells I. (La,Sr)MnO3 Based Electrodes

Sentencas: Interaction between volatile boron species and nano-sized LSM leads to the decomposition of LSM perovskite structure and the significant degradation of the electrocatalytic activity of the electrodes.
Titulo: Effect of Volatile Boron Species on the Electrocatalytic Activity of Cathodes of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells I. (La,Sr)MnO3 Based Electrodes

Sentencas: In the case of conventional LSM, the reaction between boron and LSM occurs primarily on the surface.
Titulo: Effect of Volatile Boron Species on the Electrocatalytic Activity of Cathodes of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells I. (La,Sr)MnO3 Based Electrodes

Sentencas: The agglomeration of LaBO3 and formation of nonstoichiometry thin surface may be beneficial to the removal of the segregated species on the LSM surface and thus improves the performance.
Titulo: Effect of Volatile Boron Species on the Electrocatalytic Activity of Cathodes of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells I. (La,Sr)MnO3 Based Electrodes

Sentencas: A reaction mechanism between volatile boron species and LSM electrodes is proposed.
Titulo: Effect of Volatile Boron Species on the Electrocatalytic Activity of Cathodes of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells I. (La,Sr)MnO3 Based Electrodes
